result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A Hunter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).
  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court IMPOSES AND STAYS 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence in being

----Shall the Jail sentence be imposed Mr. Hunter is ordered to report and serve the sentence with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of Huber/work release without further process.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution in the amount of $688.71 to Rebecca Waga, to be paid at a minimum of $100 per month, first payment to be made on 8/31/15 and on the last day of every month thereafter
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee

--to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay subpoena fees in the amount of $44

--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
-- to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no contact with the victim, Rebecca Waga or members of immediate family(husband and children)
--no presence within 1000 feet of Rebecca Waga's residence or place of employment, currently Demco, Inc. in Madison, WI, the agent may make exceptions for Mr. Hunter's employment purposes
--no operation of any motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and Agent approval

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.
with attached victim restitution request form(s)

Case called at 10:21am [mo]
Defendant Jeffrey A Hunter in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Service of Amended Information; reading waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1, #2, #3 and #4 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--ADA Shock submits Victim Impact Statement; the Court reviews

On Count #1 of the Amended Information, the Court IMPOSES AND STAYS 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence in being
On Count #2, of the Amended Information, the Court IMPOSES AND STAYS 2 months in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive to the sentence in Count #1
On Count #3 of the Amended Information, the Court IMPOSES AND STAYS 2 months in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive to the sentences in Counts #1 and #2
On Count  #4 of the Amended Information, the Court IMPOSES AND STAYS 2 months in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive to the sentences in Counts #1, #2 and #3
----Shall the Jail sentence be imposed Mr. Hunter is ordered to report and serve the sentence with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of Huber/work release without further process.

The Court STAYS these sentences and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
-- to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no contact with the victim, Rebecca Waga or members of immediate family(husband and children)
--no presence within 1000 feet of Rebecca Waga's residence or place of employment, currently Demco, Inc. in Madison, WI, the agent may make exceptions for Mr. Hunter's employment purposes
--no operation of any motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and Agent approval
--to pay restitution in the amount of $688.71 to Rebecca Waga, to be paid at a minimum of $100 per month, first payment to be made on 8/31/15 and on the last day of every month thereafter
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #4: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay subpoena fees in the amount of $44


Days credit for time already served:  1  day
recess: 10:47am
Letters submitted by Attorney Svehlek for use at the plea/sent hearing

Case called at 10:33 am [Clerk SH] (Final Status Scheduling Conference)
Defendant Jeffrey A Hunter in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that they are prepared to proceed to trial, but requests until EOB on Thursday to make final decision as may have another offer for assigned prosecutor
Court informs parties that It will not go until EOB Thursday, but will give parties until noon tomorrow. Will schedule plea tomorrow afternoon ot Thursday if case settles
Court explains trial/plea procedure for BrIV

Counsel agree 1 day will be needed for trial
ADA Teuber: State witnesses - 2 law enforcement officers & citizen driver
Atty Svehlek: prefer trial on Tuesday, do have speedy prelim. on Monday in another matter
Court informs parties that It will try to accommodate parties with scheduling

1 alternate; 5 strikes each
Jurors may take notes or ask questions

ADA Teuber informs the Court that they are intending use Defendant's statements in trial - Atty Svehlek confirms receipt of material, no need for Miranda Goodchild Hearing
Atty Svehlek: Mr. Hunter may be only additional witness

ADA Teuber orally motions to impeach the Defendant with prior convictions - Court requires written notice by close of business tomorrow - will take up morning of trial if filed
Court reminds Mr. Hunter that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 10:42 am 

NEXT:  Atty Svehlek to notify the Court's JA by noon tomorrow if case will plea or proceed to trial **If trial, better to proceed on Tuesday**
Jury trial on August 3/4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on July 28, 2015 at 10:30 am.

[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jeffrey A Hunter in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek requests matter be set for trial
Counsel agree 1 day is needed for tial
Court continues bond
Recess: 10:58 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule FSSC 7/28/15 at 10:30 am - Send notices (2) Schedule JT - 8/3-4/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on May 22, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 29, 2015 at 09:20 am.

[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Jeffrey A Hunter in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Plea of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Mr. Hunter that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect and confirms that address on file is accurate
Recess: 2:03 pm

NEXT: (1) Schedule DA PTC 4/29/15 at 9:20 am - Send notices (2) Schedule STC 5/22/15 at 11:00 am - Send notices
The Court concludes that the request for substitution is timely and in the propoer form

[MK]case called at 8:30am. 
Defendant Jeffrey A Hunter in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.
Mr. Hunter waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
ADA Shock files the Information.
Attorney Svehlek requests that Arraignment be scheduled on a later date.
recess 8:33am.
[Post hearing/off record Mr. Hunter verifies to the clerk that the Longwood Drive address remains current. 

NEXT:  Arraignment on 4/6/15 at 9:00am.
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 9:50am[MO]
Defendant Jeffrey A Hunter in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Svehlek indicates she has had a PTC with the State and has received the State's discovery.
Atty. Svehlek indicates she has remaining investigation to conduct and not ready for FSSC at this time. 
Atty Svehlek requests a Status Conference in 30 days.
The State verifies victim rights compliance
The Court orders a Preliminary Hearing date be set.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
recess:9:53am
[off record: Mr. Hunter verifies that his Longwood address remains current]

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing: 3/16/15 at 8:30am
Status conference on February 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 1:54 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jeffrey A Hunter appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Hunter qualifies for SPD Services

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Court finds probable cause to support Ct#1
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No contact with Rebecca Waga

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 
Recess: 1:57 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 1/14/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) Future scheduling after DA PTC - Send notices
